text: I remain calm and composed when facing tight deadlines instead of panicking.
I can identify the sources of my stress and address them proactively instead of ignoring them.
I use relaxation techniques like deep breathing or meditation when feeling overwhelmed instead of letting stress build up.
I maintain a healthy work-life balance and set boundaries instead of overcommitting myself.
I can prioritize tasks effectively under pressure instead of trying to do everything at once.
I get adequate sleep and rest to manage stress instead of sacrificing rest for work.
I can communicate my needs and limitations to others when stressed instead of keeping everything to myself.
I view challenges as opportunities for growth rather than threats that cause anxiety.
I take regular breaks during demanding periods instead of working non-stop.
I can delegate tasks when overwhelmed instead of trying to handle everything alone.
I engage in physical activity or exercise to manage stress instead of being sedentary.
I can reframe negative situations in a more positive light instead of dwelling on problems.
I practice time management to reduce last-minute pressure instead of procrastinating.
I can say 'no' to additional commitments when I'm already stressed instead of accepting everything.
I maintain social connections and seek support when needed instead of isolating myself during stressful times.
I can focus on what I can control rather than worrying about things beyond my influence.
I use problem-solving strategies when facing stressors instead of avoiding or denying them.
I can maintain perspective and see the bigger picture during stressful situations instead of catastrophizing.
I practice self-care activities that help me recharge instead of neglecting my personal needs.
I can perform effectively under pressure and use stress as motivation instead of letting it paralyze me.
